title: Business Live: Monday 21 October
text:
Reuters Copyright: Reuters China's chief trade negotiator Liu He and US President Donald Trump at the White House Image caption: China's chief trade negotiator Liu He and US President Donald Trump at the White House

Trading on Asia markets was broadly higher on Monday after China's top trade negotiator Liu He said that he had made "substantial progress" in talks with the US.

He said on Saturday China is "willing to work together with the US to address each other's core concerns on the basis of equality and mutual respect".

Hong Kong's Hang Seng index is up 0.3% while the Shanghai Composite was flat.

Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 increased 0.4%.
description: The latest news, views and analysis from the world of business and global markets.
